Structs/AcousticModel/Status.html.name: Status
Structs/AcousticModel/Status.html.abstract: The current status of the custom acoustic model: * pending indicates that the model was created but is waiting either for training data to be added or for the service to finish analyzing added data. * ready indicates that the model contains data and is ready to be trained. * training indicates that the model is currently being trained. * available indicates that the model is trained and ready to use. * upgrading indicates that the model is currently being upgraded. * failed indicates that training of the model failed.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: customizationID
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The customization ID (GUID) of the custom acoustic model. Note: When you create a new custom acoustic model, the service returns only the GUID of the new model; it does not return the other fields of this object.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: created
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) at which the custom acoustic model was created. The value is provided in full ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD).

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: language
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The language identifier of the custom acoustic model (for example, en-US).

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: versions
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: A list of the available versions of the custom acoustic model. Each element of the array indicates a version of the base model with which the custom model can be used. Multiple versions exist only if the custom model has been upgraded; otherwise, only a single version is shown.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: owner
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The GUID of the service credentials for the instance of the service that owns the custom acoustic model.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: name
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The name of the custom acoustic model.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: description
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The description of the custom acoustic model.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: baseModelName
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The name of the language model for which the custom acoustic model was created.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: status
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The current status of the custom acoustic model: * pending indicates that the model was created but is waiting either for training data to be added or for the service to finish analyzing added data. * ready indicates that the model contains data and is ready to be trained. * training indicates that the model is currently being trained. * available indicates that the model is trained and ready to use. * upgrading indicates that the model is currently being upgraded. * failed indicates that training of the model failed.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: progress
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: A percentage that indicates the progress of the custom acoustic model’s current training. A value of 100 means that the model is fully trained. Note: The progress field does not currently reflect the progress of the training; the field changes from 0 to 100 when training is complete.

Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: warnings
Structs/AcousticModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: If the request included unknown parameters, the following message: Unexpected query parameter(s) ['parameters'] detected, where parameters is a list that includes a quoted string for each unknown parameter.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionAlternative.htm.name: confidence
Structs/SpeechRecognitionAlternative.htm.abstract: A score that indicates the service’s confidence in the transcript in the range of 0 to 1. Available only for the best alternative and only in results marked as final.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionAlternative.htm.name: timestamps
Structs/SpeechRecognitionAlternative.htm.abstract: Time alignments for each word from the transcript as a list of lists. Each inner list consists of three elements: the word followed by its start and end time in seconds. Example: [["hello",0.0,1.2],["world",1.2,2.5]]. Available only for the best alternative.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionAlternative.htm.name: wordConfidence
Structs/SpeechRecognitionAlternative.htm.abstract: A confidence score for each word of the transcript as a list of lists. Each inner list consists of two elements: the word and its confidence score in the range of 0 to 1. Example: [["hello",0.95],["world",0.866]]. Available only for the best alternative and only in results marked as final.

Structs/AcousticModels.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: customizations
Structs/AcousticModels.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: An array of objects that provides information about each available custom acoustic model. The array is empty if the requesting service credentials own no custom acoustic models (if no language is specified) or own no custom acoustic models for the specified language.

Structs/CreateAcousticModel/BaseModelNam.name: BaseModelName
Structs/CreateAcousticModel/BaseModelNam.abstract: The name of the base language model that is to be customized by the new custom acoustic model. The new custom model can be used only with the base model that it customizes. To determine whether a base model supports acoustic model customization, refer to Language support for customization.

Structs/CreateAcousticModel.html#/s:14Sp.name: name
Structs/CreateAcousticModel.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: A user-defined name for the new custom acoustic model. Use a name that is unique among all custom acoustic models that you own. Use a localized name that matches the language of the custom model. Use a name that describes the acoustic environment of the custom model, such as Mobile custom model or Noisy car custom model.

Structs/CreateAcousticModel.html#/s:14Sp.name: baseModelName
Structs/CreateAcousticModel.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The name of the base language model that is to be customized by the new custom acoustic model. The new custom model can be used only with the base model that it customizes. To determine whether a base model supports acoustic model customization, refer to Language support for customization.

Structs/CreateAcousticModel.html#/s:14Sp.name: description
Structs/CreateAcousticModel.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: A description of the new custom acoustic model. Use a localized description that matches the language of the custom model.

Structs/WordTimestamp.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: startTime
Structs/WordTimestamp.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The start time, in seconds, of the given word in the audio input.

Structs/WordTimestamp.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: endTime
Structs/WordTimestamp.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The end time, in seconds, of the given word in the audio input.

Structs/WordTimestamp.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: init(from:)
Structs/WordTimestamp.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: Used internally to initialize a WordTimestamp model from JSON.

Structs/AudioResource/Status.html.name: Status
Structs/AudioResource/Status.html.abstract: The status of the audio resource: * ok indicates that the service has successfully analyzed the audio data. The data can be used to train the custom model. * being_processed indicates that the service is still analyzing the audio data. The service cannot accept requests to add new audio resources or to train the custom model until its analysis is complete. * invalid indicates that the audio data is not valid for training the custom model (possibly because it has the wrong format or sampling rate, or because it is corrupted). For an archive file, the entire archive is invalid if any of its audio files are invalid.

Structs/AudioResource.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: duration
Structs/AudioResource.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The total seconds of audio in the audio resource.

Structs/AudioResource.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: details
Structs/AudioResource.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: An AudioDetails object that provides detailed information about the audio resource. The object is empty until the service finishes processing the audio.

Structs/AudioResource.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: status
Structs/AudioResource.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The status of the audio resource: * ok indicates that the service has successfully analyzed the audio data. The data can be used to train the custom model. * being_processed indicates that the service is still analyzing the audio data. The service cannot accept requests to add new audio resources or to train the custom model until its analysis is complete. * invalid indicates that the audio data is not valid for training the custom model (possibly because it has the wrong format or sampling rate, or because it is corrupted). For an archive file, the entire archive is invalid if any of its audio files are invalid.

Structs/AudioDetails/ModelType.html.name: ModelType
Structs/AudioDetails/ModelType.html.abstract: The type of the audio resource: * audio for an individual audio file * archive for an archive (.zip or .tar.gz) file that contains audio files.

Structs/AudioDetails/Compression.html.name: Compression
Structs/AudioDetails/Compression.html.abstract: For an archive-type resource,** the format of the compressed archive: * zip for a .zip file * gzip for a .tar.gz file Omitted for an audio-type resource.

Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: type
Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: The type of the audio resource: * audio for an individual audio file * archive for an archive (.zip or .tar.gz) file that contains audio files.

Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: codec
Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an audio-type resource,** the codec in which the audio is encoded. Omitted for an archive-type resource.

Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: frequency
Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an audio-type resource,** the sampling rate of the audio in Hertz (samples per second). Omitted for an archive-type resource.

Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: compression
Structs/AudioDetails.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an archive-type resource,** the format of the compressed archive: * zip for a .zip file * gzip for a .tar.gz file Omitted for an audio-type resource.

Structs/CreateLanguageModel/BaseModelNam.name: BaseModelName
Structs/CreateLanguageModel/BaseModelNam.abstract: The name of the base language model that is to be customized by the new custom language model. The new custom model can be used only with the base model that it customizes. To determine whether a base model supports language model customization, request information about the base model and check that the attribute custom_language_model is set to true, or refer to Language support for customization.

Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.name: name
Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: A user-defined name for the new custom language model. Use a name that is unique among all custom language models that you own. Use a localized name that matches the language of the custom model. Use a name that describes the domain of the custom model, such as Medical custom model or Legal custom model.

Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.name: baseModelName
Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The name of the base language model that is to be customized by the new custom language model. The new custom model can be used only with the base model that it customizes. To determine whether a base model supports language model customization, request information about the base model and check that the attribute custom_language_model is set to true, or refer to Language support for customization.

Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.name: dialect
Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The dialect of the specified language that is to be used with the custom language model. The parameter is meaningful only for Spanish models, for which the service creates a custom language model that is suited for speech in one of the following dialects: * es-ES for Castilian Spanish (the default) * es-LA for Latin American Spanish * es-US for North American (Mexican) Spanish A specified dialect must be valid for the base model. By default, the dialect matches the language of the base model; for example, en-US for either of the US English language models.

Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.name: description
Structs/CreateLanguageModel.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: A description of the new custom language model. Use a localized description that matches the language of the custom model.

Structs/WordConfidence.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: confidence
Structs/WordConfidence.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The confidence of the given word, between 0 and 1.

Structs/WordConfidence.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: init(from:)
Structs/WordConfidence.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: Used internally to initialize a WordConfidence model from JSON.

Structs/Words.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV15W.name: words
Structs/Words.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV15W.abstract: Information about each word in the custom model’s words resource. The array is empty if the custom model has no words.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.name: finalResults
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.abstract: An indication of whether the transcription results are final. If true, the results for this utterance are not updated further; no additional results are sent for a result_index once its results are indicated as final.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.name: alternatives
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.abstract: An array of alternative transcripts. The alternatives array can include additional requested output such as word confidence or timestamps.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.name: keywordsResult
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.abstract: A dictionary (or associative array) whose keys are the strings specified for keywords if both that parameter and keywords_threshold are specified. A keyword for which no matches are found is omitted from the array. You can spot a maximum of 1000 keywords. The array is omitted if no keywords are found.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.name: wordAlternatives
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResult.html#/s:.abstract: An array of alternative hypotheses found for words of the input audio if a word_alternatives_threshold is specified.

Structs/RegisterStatus/Status.html.name: Status
Structs/RegisterStatus/Status.html.abstract: The current status of the job: * created if the callback URL was successfully white-listed as a result of the call. * already created if the URL was already white-listed.

Structs/RegisterStatus.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: status
Structs/RegisterStatus.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The current status of the job: * created if the callback URL was successfully white-listed as a result of the call. * already created if the URL was already white-listed.

Structs/RegisterStatus.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: url
Structs/RegisterStatus.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The callback URL that is successfully registered.

Structs/AudioResources.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: totalMinutesOfAudio
Structs/AudioResources.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The total minutes of accumulated audio summed over all of the valid audio resources for the custom acoustic model. You can use this value to determine whether the custom model has too little or too much audio to begin training.

Structs/AudioResources.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: audio
Structs/AudioResources.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: An array of AudioResource objects that provides information about the audio resources of the custom acoustic model. The array is empty if the custom model has no audio resources.

Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.name: name
Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.abstract: The name of the model for use as an identifier in calls to the service (for example, en-US_BroadbandModel).

Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.name: language
Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.abstract: The language identifier of the model (for example, en-US).

Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.name: rate
Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.abstract: The sampling rate (minimum acceptable rate for audio) used by the model in Hertz.

Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.name: supportedFeatures
Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.abstract: Describes the additional service features supported with the model.

Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.name: sessions
Structs/SpeechModel.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.abstract: The URI for the model for use with the Create a session method. (Returned only for requests for a single model with the Get a model method.).

Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: normalizedText
Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: A specified keyword normalized to the spoken phrase that matched in the audio input.

Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: startTime
Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The start time in seconds of the keyword match.

Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: endTime
Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The end time in seconds of the keyword match.

Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: confidence
Structs/KeywordResult.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: A confidence score for the keyword match in the range of 0 to 1.

Structs/SupportedFeatures.html#/s:14Spee.name: customLanguageModel
Structs/SupportedFeatures.html#/s:14Spee.abstract: Indicates whether the customization interface can be used to create a custom language model based on the language model.

Structs/SupportedFeatures.html#/s:14Spee.name: speakerLabels
Structs/SupportedFeatures.html#/s:14Spee.abstract: Indicates whether the speaker_labels parameter can be used with the language model.

Structs/LanguageModels.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: customizations
Structs/LanguageModels.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: An array of objects that provides information about each available custom language model. The array is empty if the requesting service credentials own no custom language models (if no language is specified) or own no custom language models for the specified language.

Structs/CustomWords.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.name: words
Structs/CustomWords.html#/s:14SpeechToTe.abstract: An array of objects that provides information about each custom word that is to be added to or updated in the custom language model.

Structs/Corpus/Status.html.name: Status
Structs/Corpus/Status.html.abstract: The status of the corpus: * analyzed indicates that the service has successfully analyzed the corpus; the custom model can be trained with data from the corpus. * being_processed indicates that the service is still analyzing the corpus; the service cannot accept requests to add new corpora or words, or to train the custom model. * undetermined indicates that the service encountered an error while processing the corpus.

Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.name: totalWords
Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.abstract: The total number of words in the corpus. The value is 0 while the corpus is being processed.

Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.name: outOfVocabularyWords
Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.abstract: The number of OOV words in the corpus. The value is 0 while the corpus is being processed.

Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.name: status
Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.abstract: The status of the corpus: * analyzed indicates that the service has successfully analyzed the corpus; the custom model can be trained with data from the corpus. * being_processed indicates that the service is still analyzing the corpus; the service cannot accept requests to add new corpora or words, or to train the custom model. * undetermined indicates that the service encountered an error while processing the corpus.

Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.name: error
Structs/Corpus.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV16.abstract: If the status of the corpus is undetermined, the following message: Analysis of corpus 'name' failed. Please try adding the corpus again by setting the 'allow_overwrite' flag to 'true'.

Structs/WordError.html#/s:14SpeechToText.name: element
Structs/WordError.html#/s:14SpeechToText.abstract: A key-value pair that describes an error associated with the definition of a word in the words resource. Each pair has the format "element": "message", where element is the aspect of the definition that caused the problem and message describes the problem. The following example describes a problem with one of the word’s sounds-like definitions: "sounds_like_string": "Numbers are not allowed in sounds-like. You can try for example 'suggested_string'." You must correct the error before you can train the model.

Structs/WordAlternativeResult.html#/s:14.name: confidence
Structs/WordAlternativeResult.html#/s:14.abstract: A confidence score for the word alternative hypothesis in the range of 0 to 1.

Structs/WordAlternativeResult.html#/s:14.name: word
Structs/WordAlternativeResult.html#/s:14.abstract: An alternative hypothesis for a word from the input audio.

Structs/RecognitionJob/Status.html.name: Status
Structs/RecognitionJob/Status.html.abstract: The current status of the job: * waiting: The service is preparing the job for processing. The service returns this status when the job is initially created or when it is waiting for capacity to process the job. The job remains in this state until the service has the capacity to begin processing it. * processing: The service is actively processing the job. * completed: The service has finished processing the job. If the job specified a callback URL and the event recognitions.completed_with_results, the service sent the results with the callback notification; otherwise, you must retrieve the results by checking the individual job. * failed: The job failed.

Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: status
Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The current status of the job: * waiting: The service is preparing the job for processing. The service returns this status when the job is initially created or when it is waiting for capacity to process the job. The job remains in this state until the service has the capacity to begin processing it. * processing: The service is actively processing the job. * completed: The service has finished processing the job. If the job specified a callback URL and the event recognitions.completed_with_results, the service sent the results with the callback notification; otherwise, you must retrieve the results by checking the individual job. * failed: The job failed.

Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: created
Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) at which the job was created. The value is provided in full ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD).

Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: updated
Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) at which the job was last updated by the service. The value is provided in full ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD). Note: This field is returned only when you list information about a specific or all existing jobs.

Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: url
Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The URL to use to request information about the job with the Check a job method. Note: This field is returned only when you create a new job.

Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: userToken
Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: The user token associated with a job that was created with a callback URL and a user token. Note: This field can be returned only when you list information about all existing jobs.

Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: results
Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: If the status is completed, the results of the recognition request as an array that includes a single instance of a SpeechRecognitionResults object. Note: This field can be returned only when you list information about a specific existing job.

Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.name: warnings
Structs/RecognitionJob.html#/s:14SpeechT.abstract: An array of warning messages about invalid parameters included with the request. Each warning includes a descriptive message and a list of invalid argument strings, for example, "unexpected query parameter 'user_token', query parameter 'callback_url' was not specified". The request succeeds despite the warnings. Note: This field can be returned only when you create a new job.

Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: recognizeWS
Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: URI for WebSocket recognition requests. Note: This field is needed only for working with the WebSocket interface.

Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: sessionID
Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: Identifier for the new session. Note: This field is returned only when you create a new session.

Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: newSessionUri
Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: URI for the new session. Note: This field is returned only when you create a new session.

Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: state
Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: State of the session. The state must be initialized for the session to accept another recognition request. Other internal states are possible, but they have no meaning for the user. Note: This field is returned only when you request the status of an existing session.

Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: model
Structs/SpeechSession.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: URI for information about the model that is used with the session. Note: This field is returned only when you request the status of an existing session.

Structs/LanguageModel/Status.html.name: Status
Structs/LanguageModel/Status.html.abstract: The current status of the custom language model: * pending indicates that the model was created but is waiting either for training data to be added or for the service to finish analyzing added data. * ready indicates that the model contains data and is ready to be trained. * training indicates that the model is currently being trained. * available indicates that the model is trained and ready to use. * upgrading indicates that the model is currently being upgraded. * failed indicates that training of the model failed.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: customizationID
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The customization ID (GUID) of the custom language model. Note: When you create a new custom language model, the service returns only the GUID of the new model; it does not return the other fields of this object.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: created
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) at which the custom language model was created. The value is provided in full ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD).

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: language
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The language identifier of the custom language model (for example, en-US).

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: dialect
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The dialect of the language for the custom language model. By default, the dialect matches the language of the base model; for example, en-US for either of the US English language models. For Spanish models, the field indicates the dialect for which the model was created: * es-ES for Castilian Spanish (the default) * es-LA for Latin American Spanish * es-US for North American (Mexican) Spanish.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: versions
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: A list of the available versions of the custom language model. Each element of the array indicates a version of the base model with which the custom model can be used. Multiple versions exist only if the custom model has been upgraded; otherwise, only a single version is shown.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: owner
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The GUID of the service credentials for the instance of the service that owns the custom language model.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: name
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The name of the custom language model.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: description
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The description of the custom language model.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: baseModelName
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The name of the language model for which the custom language model was created.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: status
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: The current status of the custom language model: * pending indicates that the model was created but is waiting either for training data to be added or for the service to finish analyzing added data. * ready indicates that the model contains data and is ready to be trained. * training indicates that the model is currently being trained. * available indicates that the model is trained and ready to use. * upgrading indicates that the model is currently being upgraded. * failed indicates that training of the model failed.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: progress
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: A percentage that indicates the progress of the custom language model’s current training. A value of 100 means that the model is fully trained. Note: The progress field does not currently reflect the progress of the training; the field changes from 0 to 100 when training is complete.

Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.name: warnings
Structs/LanguageModel.html#/s:14SpeechTo.abstract: If the request included unknown parameters, the following message: Unexpected query parameter(s) ['parameters'] detected, where parameters is a list that includes a quoted string for each unknown parameter.

Structs/RecognitionJobs.html#/s:14Speech.name: recognitions
Structs/RecognitionJobs.html#/s:14Speech.abstract: An array of objects that provides the status for each of the user’s current jobs. The array is empty if the user has no current jobs.

Structs/CustomWord.html#/s:14SpeechToTex.name: word
Structs/CustomWord.html#/s:14SpeechToTex.abstract: When specifying an array of one or more words,** you must specify the custom word that is to be added to or updated in the custom model. Do not include spaces in the word. Use a - (dash) or _ (underscore) to connect the tokens of compound words. When adding or updating a single word directly, omit this field.

Structs/CustomWord.html#/s:14SpeechToTex.name: soundsLike
Structs/CustomWord.html#/s:14SpeechToTex.abstract: An array of sounds-like pronunciations for the custom word. Specify how words that are difficult to pronounce, foreign words, acronyms, and so on can be pronounced by users. For a word that is not in the service’s base vocabulary, omit the parameter to have the service automatically generate a sounds-like pronunciation for the word. For a word that is in the service’s base vocabulary, use the parameter to specify additional pronunciations for the word. You cannot override the default pronunciation of a word; pronunciations you add augment the pronunciation from the base vocabulary. A word can have at most five sounds-like pronunciations, and a pronunciation can include at most 40 characters not including spaces.

Structs/CustomWord.html#/s:14SpeechToTex.name: displayAs
Structs/CustomWord.html#/s:14SpeechToTex.abstract: An alternative spelling for the custom word when it appears in a transcript. Use the parameter when you want the word to have a spelling that is different from its usual representation or from its spelling in corpora training data.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.name: results
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.abstract: An array that can include interim and final results (interim results are returned only if supported by the method). Final results are guaranteed not to change; interim results might be replaced by further interim results and final results. The service periodically sends updates to the results list; the result_index is set to the lowest index in the array that has changed; it is incremented for new results.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.name: resultIndex
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.abstract: An index that indicates a change point in the results array. The service increments the index only for additional results that it sends for new audio for the same request.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.name: speakerLabels
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.abstract: An array that identifies which words were spoken by which speakers in a multi-person exchange. Returned in the response only if speaker_labels is true. When interim results are also requested for methods that support them, it is possible for a SpeechRecognitionResults object to include only the speaker_labels field.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.name: warnings
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResults.html#/s.abstract: An array of warning messages associated with the request: * Warnings for invalid parameters or fields can include a descriptive message and a list of invalid argument strings, for example, "Unknown arguments:" or "Unknown url query arguments:" followed by a list of the form "invalid_arg_1, invalid_arg_2." * The following warning is returned if the request passes a custom model that is based on an older version of a base model for which an updated version is available: "Using previous version of base model, because your custom model has been built with it. Please note that this version will be supported only for a limited time. Consider updating your custom model to the new base model. If you do not do that you will be automatically switched to base model when you used the non-updated custom model." In both cases, the request succeeds despite the warnings.

Structs/WordAlternativeResults.html#/s:1.name: startTime
Structs/WordAlternativeResults.html#/s:1.abstract: The start time in seconds of the word from the input audio that corresponds to the word alternatives.

Structs/WordAlternativeResults.html#/s:1.name: endTime
Structs/WordAlternativeResults.html#/s:1.abstract: The end time in seconds of the word from the input audio that corresponds to the word alternatives.

Structs/WordAlternativeResults.html#/s:1.name: alternatives
Structs/WordAlternativeResults.html#/s:1.abstract: An array of alternative hypotheses for a word from the input audio.

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: contentType
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The format of the audio data. Endianness is automatically detected by the Speech to Text

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: inactivityTimeout
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The number of seconds after which the connection is to time out due to inactivity.

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: keywords
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: An array of keyword strings to be matched in the input audio. By default, the service

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: keywordsThreshold
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: A minimum level of confidence that the service must have to report a matching keyword

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: maxAlternatives
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The maximum number of alternative transcriptions to receive. The default is 1.

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: interimResults
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: If true, then interim results (i.e. results that are not final) will be received

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: wordAlternativesThreshold
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: A minimum level of confidence that the service must have to report a hypothesis for a

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: wordConfidence
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: If true, then a confidence score will be received for each word of the transcription.

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: timestamps
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: If true, then per-word start and end times relative to the beginning of the audio will

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: filterProfanity
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: If true, then profanity will be censored from the service’s output, obscuring each

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: smartFormatting
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Indicates whether dates, times, series of digits and numbers, phone numbers, currency values,

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: speakerLabels
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: If true, then speaker labels will be returned for each timestamp. The default is false.

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.name: init(contentType:)
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Initialize a RecognitionSettings object to set the parameters of a Watson Speech to

Structs/AudioListing/Status.html.name: Status
Structs/AudioListing/Status.html.abstract: For an audio-type resource,** the status of the resource: * ok indicates that the service has successfully analyzed the audio data. The data can be used to train the custom model. * being_processed indicates that the service is still analyzing the audio data. The service cannot accept requests to add new audio resources or to train the custom model until its analysis is complete. * invalid indicates that the audio data is not valid for training the custom model (possibly because it has the wrong format or sampling rate, or because it is corrupted). Omitted for an archive-type resource.

Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: duration
Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an audio-type resource,** the total seconds of audio in the resource. Omitted for an archive-type resource.

Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: name
Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an audio-type resource,** the name of the resource. Omitted for an archive-type resource.

Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: details
Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an audio-type resource,** an AudioDetails object that provides detailed information about the resource. The object is empty until the service finishes processing the audio. Omitted for an archive-type resource.

Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: status
Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an audio-type resource,** the status of the resource: * ok indicates that the service has successfully analyzed the audio data. The data can be used to train the custom model. * being_processed indicates that the service is still analyzing the audio data. The service cannot accept requests to add new audio resources or to train the custom model until its analysis is complete. * invalid indicates that the audio data is not valid for training the custom model (possibly because it has the wrong format or sampling rate, or because it is corrupted). Omitted for an archive-type resource.

Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: container
Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an archive-type resource,** an object of type AudioResource that provides information about the resource. Omitted for an audio-type resource.

Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: audio
Structs/AudioListing.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: For an archive-type resource,** an array of AudioResource objects that provides information about the audio-type resources that are contained in the resource. Omitted for an audio-type resource.

Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.name: from
Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The start time of a word from the transcript. The value matches the start time of a word from the timestamps array.

Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.name: to
Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The end time of a word from the transcript. The value matches the end time of a word from the timestamps array.

Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.name: speaker
Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The numeric identifier that the service assigns to a speaker from the audio. Speaker IDs begin at 0 initially but can evolve and change across interim results (if supported by the method) and between interim and final results as the service processes the audio. They are not guaranteed to be sequential, contiguous, or ordered.

Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.name: confidence
Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: A score that indicates the service’s confidence in its identification of the speaker in the range of 0 to 1.

Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.name: finalResults
Structs/SpeakerLabelsResult.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: An indication of whether the service might further change word and speaker-label results. A value of true means that the service guarantees not to send any further updates for the current or any preceding results; false means that the service might send further updates to the results.

Structs/Corpora.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.name: corpora
Structs/Corpora.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.abstract: Information about corpora of the custom model. The array is empty if the custom model has no corpora.

Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.name: word
Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.abstract: A word from the custom model’s words resource. The spelling of the word is used to train the model.

Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.name: soundsLike
Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.abstract: An array of pronunciations for the word. The array can include the sounds-like pronunciation automatically generated by the service if none is provided for the word; the service adds this pronunciation when it finishes processing the word.

Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.name: displayAs
Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.abstract: The spelling of the word that the service uses to display the word in a transcript. The field contains an empty string if no display-as value is provided for the word, in which case the word is displayed as it is spelled.

Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.name: count
Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.abstract: A sum of the number of times the word is found across all corpora. For example, if the word occurs five times in one corpus and seven times in another, its count is 12. If you add a custom word to a model before it is added by any corpora, the count begins at 1; if the word is added from a corpus first and later modified, the count reflects only the number of times it is found in corpora.

Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.name: source
Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.abstract: An array of sources that describes how the word was added to the custom model’s words resource. For OOV words added from a corpus, includes the name of the corpus; if the word was added by multiple corpora, the names of all corpora are listed. If the word was modified or added by the user directly, the field includes the string user.

Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.name: error
Structs/Word.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14Wo.abstract: If the service discovered one or more problems that you need to correct for the word’s definition, an array that describes each of the errors.

Structs/SpeechRecognitionResultsAccumula.name: bestTranscript
Structs/SpeechRecognitionResultsAccumula.abstract: A concatenation of transcripts with the greatest confidence.

Structs/RecognitionSettings.html.name: RecognitionSettings
Structs/RecognitionSettings.html.abstract: The settings associated with a Speech to Text recognition request. Any nil parameters will

Structs/WordConfidence.html.name: WordConfidence
Structs/WordConfidence.html.abstract: The confidence of a word in a Speech to Text transcription.

Structs.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV111JSONWr.name: JSONWrapper
Structs.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV111JSONWr.abstract: Used internally to serialize and deserialize JSON.

Structs/WordTimestamp.html.name: WordTimestamp
Structs/WordTimestamp.html.abstract: The timestamp of a word in a Speech to Text transcription.

Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.name: noResponse
Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.abstract: No response was received from the server.

Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.name: noData
Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.abstract: No data was returned from the server.

Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.name: encodingError
Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.abstract: Failed to replace special characters in the

Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.name: fileManagerError
Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.abstract: FileManager failed to handle the given file.

Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.name: failure
Enums/RestError.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV1.abstract: An HTTP error with a status code and description.

Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.name: int
Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.abstract: A number value, represented as an integer.

Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.name: double
Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.abstract: A number value, represented as a double.

Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.name: init(from:)
Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.abstract: Initialize a JSON value from an encodable type.

Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.name: toValue(_:)
Enums/JSON.html#/s:14SpeechToTextV14JSON.abstract: Convert this JSON value to a decodable type.

Enums/JSON.html.name: JSON
Enums/JSON.html.abstract: A JSON value (one of string, number, object, array, true, false, or null).

Enums/RestError.html.name: RestError
Enums/RestError.html.abstract: An error from processing a network request or response.

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: serviceURL
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: The base URL to use when contacting the service.

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: tokenURL
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: The URL that shall be used to obtain a token.

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: websocketsURL
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: The URL that shall be used to stream audio for transcription.

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: defaultHeaders
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: The default HTTP headers for all requests to the service.

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: recognizeSessionless(model:customizationID:acousticCustomizationID:baseModelVersion:customizationWeight:audio:contentType:inactivityTimeout:keywords:keywordsThreshold:maxAlternatives:wordAlternativesThreshold:wordConfidence:timestamps:profanityFilter:smartFormatting:speakerLabels:failure:success:)
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: Sends audio for speech recognition in sessionless mode.

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: recognize(audio:settings:model:customizationID:learningOptOut:failure:success:)
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: Perform speech recognition for an audio file.

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: recognizeMicrophone(settings:model:customizationID:learningOptOut:compress:failure:success:)
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: Perform speech recognition for microphone audio. To stop the microphone, invoke

Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.name: stopRecognizeMicrophone()
Classes/SpeechToText.html#/s:14SpeechToT.abstract: Stop performing speech recognition for microphone audio.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: serviceURL
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The base URL of the Speech to Text service.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: tokenURL
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The URL that shall be used to obtain a token.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: websocketsURL
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The URL that shall be used to stream audio for transcription.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: defaultHeaders
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The default HTTP headers for all requests to the service.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: results
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: The results of the most recent recognition request.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: onConnect
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Invoked when the session connects to the Speech to Text service.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: onMicrophoneData
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Invoked with microphone audio when a recording audio queue buffer has been filled.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: onPowerData
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Invoked every 0.025s when recording with the average dB power of the microphone.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: onResults
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Invoked when transcription results are received for a recognition request.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: onError
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Invoked when an error or warning occurs.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: onDisconnect
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Invoked when the session disconnects from the Speech to Text service.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: init(username:password:model:customizationID:learningOptOut:)
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Create a SpeechToTextSession object.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: connect()
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Connect to the Speech to Text service.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: startRequest(settings:)
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Start a recognition request.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: recognize(audio:)
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Send an audio file to transcribe.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: recognize(audio:)
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Send audio data to transcribe.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: startMicrophone(compress:)
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Start streaming microphone audio data to transcribe.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: stopMicrophone()
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Stop streaming microphone audio data to transcribe.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: stopRequest()
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Stop the recognition request.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.name: disconnect()
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html#/s:14Sp.abstract: Wait for any queued recognition requests to complete then disconnect from the service.

Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html.name: SpeechToTextSession
Classes/SpeechToTextSession.html.abstract: The IBM Watson Speech to Text service enables you to add speech transcription capabilities to

Classes/SpeechToText.html.name: SpeechToText
Classes/SpeechToText.html.abstract: The IBM Watson Speech to Text service provides an API that enables you to add IBM’s speech recognition capabilities to
